intro: Burmeistera globosa, commonly known as the globular burmeistera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its spherical, greenish-brown fruit that resembles a small ball. The plant produces showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
